page.title: 15Landscape of the Valley
page.content: The landscape of the block is varied. Main roads run along the valleys connecting the old settlements with a ribbon development of houses and factories which are right by the roadside. There are few streets at right angles to the road;where there are they do not extend far and the effect is claustrophobic. Immediately behind the houses the land rises steeply.The lower slopes are used for dairy and sheep farming and horse breeding. Very few fields are cultivated other than for hay. There are vast stretches of open moorland above 1000 feet which support heathers or bog. Many tracks and old roads connect valleys over the moors. Nowadays these are enjoyable walks for ramblers and everywhere the moors can be seen rising above the rooftops.
